div.bibl: The Sentinel, Wk. of August 31, 1923. Vols. 51-52, p.15.

body.p: Leon Zolotkoff, former Assistant State's Attorney of Cook County and a noted Yiddish litterateur and Zionist, dreamed of founding in Jerusalem a national printing establishment. After a struggle he has at last succeeded. His organization gives employment to many workers and is destined to become a famous Hebrew and Yiddish publishing center for world Jewry.
